Scenario: As you going down the street, you see a mob of people in front of you who seem to be stopped.  While you are wondering why anyone would stop, you are accosted by an odd looking man, dressed in a brown robe and hood with a cross around his neck.
Response A: I run
Response B: I punch the guy in the face
Response C: I wonder what on earth he wants

Scenario: He grabs your bag as you try to avoid him
Response A: I drop the bag and run anyhow
Response B: I punch the guy in the face
Response C: I stop

Scenario: The man falls down to the ground, bleeding from the nose.  You would be arrested if there were any police nearby, but there are not.  You have added to the impression that the world is ending and has become lawless.
Response A: I run
Response B: I cheer
Response C: I kick the guy in the nuts and run

Scenario: The man gets a bit too close to you and says "Do you realize, good citizen, that this planet was designed for us by God?"
Response A: I say "I'm not religious"
Response B: I say "Please leave me alone"
Response C: I say "Go away"

Scenario: You run towards the stopped crowd ahead, and the man goes after some other poor slob
Response A: I cheer
Response B: I stay very quiet
Response C: I go back after my bag

Scenario: You try to pull the suitcase away from the brown man, but he screams that you are a robber.  Passers-by support the man in brown.
Response A: I complain that it's my bag!
Response B: I tell the passers by that the man doesn't know what is in the bag, so it must be mine
Response C: I beg the passers-by for help, I need my belongings for the spaceship

Scenario: The passers-by question the man, and when they realize he thinks they should all stay on the planet, they make him give you your bag back.
Response A: I cheer
Response B: I stay very quiet
Response C: I thank the passers-by

Scenario: Another person comes up to you and gives you your bag back, because he noticed the man dropping it & had seen the man steal it from you.
Response A: I say "Thank you so much!"
Response B: I say "You are a wonderful person!"
Response C: I say "Awesome!"

Scenario: The man ignores you and continues. "How can we leave God's planet?  How can we abandon him?  We must stay, even though it costs us our lives!"
Response A: I say "What makes you think God didn't create the other planets?"
Response B: I say "I don't believe in a God like that"
Response C: I say "God is with us always, everywhere, it doesn't matter where we are, so it doesn't matter what planet we are on"

Scenario: As the man goes on and on, ignoring anything you say, you realize that there is no convincing him.  You decide that while he may be fine with dying in an exploding planet, you are not, and wish to live.
Response A: I run
Response B: I punch the guy in the face
Response C: I call him an idiot and say he should go to hell

Scenario: The man is so distracted and so dumb he doesn't notice you runing.
Response A: I cheer
Response B: I stay quiet
Response C: I laugh

Scenario: The man falls and trys to knock you down.
Response A: I kick him in the balls
Response B: I leave him to die in the volcano to come
Response C: I laugh

Scenario: The man continues by saying that God will take us all in.
Response A: I stick my tongue out at him and leave
Response B: I point at a guy and say he doesn't want to stay
Response C: I run

Scenario: The man comes back over to you and says you must stay.
Response A: I stick my tongue out at him and leave
Response B: I knock him out
Response C: I hit him with my suitcase

Scenario: The man pulls you down.
Response A: I kick his head
Response B: I pull him up
Response C: I shove a rock in his head

Scenario: You get away from the odd man and proceed up the road.  The large group of people in front of you appear to have stopped entirely in the next intersection, which is a problem because people are arriving every second!
Response A: I go straight ahead to see what is going on
Response B: I try to make it around to the right
Response C: I try to make it around to the left

Scenario: You go ahead into the crowd.  You have to push through the crowd to get towards the front.  You keep a tight grip on your suitcase. In front of you, you see a group of people seem to be blocking everyone
Response A: I go further forward to figure out the situation
Response B: I try to make it around the left
Response C: I try to make it around to the right

Scenario: You go around to the right, trying to skirt the crowd and go down the street.  Unfortunately, this side street is only running the other direction, and you cannot get through anywhere.
Response A: I go straight ahead into the crowd
Response B: I try to make it around the left
Response C: I jump up and down to try to see more

Scenario: You go to the left, but the road is blocked there as well and there is a huge crowd between you and any further progress
Response A: I try to make it around to the right
Response B: I try the straight-ahead direction
Response C: I push forward into the crowd

Scenario: Jumping up and down doesn't help
Response A: I go straight ahead to see what is going on
Response B: I try to make it around the left
Response C: I try to make it around to the right

Scenario: The group of people blocking everyone are standing in a long line, connected hand-to-hand in a chain of people across the entire road.  No one is getting through.  They seem to be chanting something.
Response A: I listen to what they are chanting
Response B: I ask someone around what is going on
Response C: I yell at everyone to MOVE!

Scenario: You listen carefully and realize they are chanting "One God, One Planet" over & over & over again
Response A: I ask someone what is going on
Response B: I yell at everyone to MOVE!
Response C: I wait to see what will happen

Scenario: Talking isn't easy in all this crowd noise, but you find someone who says that this seems to be a group of religious people who don't want anyone to leave the planet, that we should all die with the planet if that is God's will.
Response A: I point out that this actually makes no sense, because God created all the planets
Response B: I point out that I don't care about them, we all need to get to the shuttle port!
Response C: I say "Fine, they can stay--I'm going!"

Scenario: Yelling doesn't help at all.  Many people are now yelling and no one can hear themselves think!
Response A: I listen to what they are chanting
Response B: I ask someone around what is going on
Response C: I wait to see what will happen

Scenario: All that happens is more people come and the crowd gets larger and more annoyed
Response A: I wait more
Response B: I ask someone around what is going on
Response C: I listen to what they are chanting

Scenario: A 12 year old behind you says "Great words, but we need action!!!"  He starts moving purposefully towards the line of people.
Response A: I go with him
Response B: I watch in awe
Response C: I wonder who that kid is?
